issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Wahram IV on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown cap; crown with mural element and two staggered wings; covered korymbos; ribbons between crown cap and korymbos pointing to the left, pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing below ball of hair; earing consisting of two elements; tunica, neck-line edged with double row of pearls running from shoulder to the breast ornament (only upper part visible); dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. mzdysn bgy wrhr'n MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n W 'nyr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n| mazdēsn bay Wahrām šāhān šāh Ērān ud Anērān kē čihr az yazdān|"The Mazda-worshiping divine Wahram, King of Kings of the Iranians and non-Iranians, whose seeds/splendour is from the gods
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; square, vertically ribbed altar shaft; four altar plates; small triangle attached to altar table, below these ribbed ribbons; altar flames; to the left and right of altar pillar in the form of a lion's paw resting on mushroom-shaped object; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 1 h l. i. l'sty,11 h l. o. wrhr'n| ādur ī Wahrām|“the fire of Wahram”
